title: GnuPG libksba CRL File Parsing Stack-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of GnuPG libksba. Interaction with this library is required to exploit this vulnerability but attack vectors may vary depending on the implementation.
The specific flaw exists within the parsing of CRL files. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of the length of user-supplied data prior to copying it to a fixed-length stack-based buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the current process.
addtionnal_details: GnuPG has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=1021928
timeline:
2022-10-04 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2022-10-25 - Coordinated public release of advisory
